intro: Synotis damiaoshanica, commonly known as the Damiaoshan synotis, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and mountainous regions, thriving in cool, humid climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
